name: Grandma's Old-Fashioned Cake Donuts
author: Michael Yeo
summary: This is a recipe handed down from my Grandma Thayer. My family tradition is to make these old-fashioned cake donuts Christmas morning. Enjoy! Roll warm donuts in sugar and cinnamon, if desired.
ingredients: ½ cup vegetable oil for frying
directions: Beat eggs in the bowl of a stand mixer until whipped to a creamy color
Mix in sugar gradually until well blended
Mix in buttermilk and vanilla extract
Sift flour, baking soda, baking powder, nutmeg, and salt together in a separate bowl
Beat 1/2 of the mixture into the sugar mixture until well blended; beat in remaining 1/2
Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Turn dough out onto a floured surface and knead as little as possible until it comes together
Roll dough out using a rolling pin until it is 3/8-inch thick; cut into donut shapes
Lower donuts carefully into the hot oil and cook until light brown, 2 to 3 minutes, turning once
Remove from oil and let cool on a wire rack
